intro: Ophelia baxteri, commonly known as the common water plantain, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of North America. It is characterized by its broad, sword-shaped leaves that float on the surface of still or slow-moving freshwater. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in shallow water and is often found in ponds, lakes, and marshes. Ophelia baxteri plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
